he Serpents Demise was a boisterous inn and tavern in the city of Taruin, Samarach.
The Serpents Demise offered drinks and food to its guests as well as lodgings. The establishment was among very few places open to non-citizens of Samarach. The taverns taproom was constructed in a traditional way for drinking establishments in Samarach. The taproom was built in the shape of a cross. Tables, booths, and places to mingle were placed at each end of the structure. At the center stood the bar from where the innkeeper did business. The Serpents Demise employed musicians and dancers who entertained its guests.
In the , the Serpents Demise was frequented by a wine connoisseur named Ottelmar who sought out adventurers brave enough to acquire him rare deepwine from a mind flayer black market.
